page.title: 05MEDIA CLAPHAM MAGAZINE
page.content: The Dalesman Publishing Company is about threequarters of the way up the village of Clapham.Mr.Scott started it in his house in April 1939.All the items that belonged to it were kept in a shoe box at first. They publish two magazines a month now_a_days,the Dalesman and the Cumbria.Forty eight books are published a year,four a month and one a week. The magazines are sent just about everywhere in the world. The books are about Northern England and railways. The magazines are printed in Bradford.The books are printed in Hull,Bradford,Keighley and Nelson. Mr.Joy has worked there twenty years and Mr.Mitchell has worked there nearly forty years.A full page colour advert costs Â£600.
